 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8  3 coverage, according to the database, of a specific individual
  8  4 or motor vehicle for the time period designated by the
  8  5 government agency or court.
  8  6    c.  Upon request, the department or its designated agent
  8  7 shall disclose whether an individual is covered under a motor
  8  8 vehicle insurance policy and the insurance company name to:
  8  9    (1)  The individual or, if the individual is deceased,
  8 10 any person who is an interested party in the estate of the
  8 11 individual as provided under chapter 633.
  8 12    (2)  The parent or legal guardian of the individual if the
  8 13 individual is an unemancipated minor.
  8 14    (3)  The legal guardian of the individual if the individual
  8 15 is legally incapacitated.
  8 16    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  8 17    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the
  8 18 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
  8 21 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
  8 22 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.
  9 29                           EXPLANATION
  9 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  9 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  9 32    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
  9 33 program within the department of transportation.  The
  9 34 department is required to contract with a third party to act
  9 35 as the department's designated agent for administration of the
 10  1 program.
 10  2    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain
 10  3 a database containing information from insurers relating to
 10  4 motor vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles,
 10  5 personal identification information for licensed drivers
 10  6 provided by the department, and any other information provided
 10  7 to the designated agent by the department.
 10  8    At least twice a month, the designated agent shall update the
 10  9 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 10 10 updated insurance information.  The files in the database shall
 10 11 be archived semiannually and audited by the department at least
 10 12 annually.  The bill requires the department to adopt rules for
 10 13 administration of the database.
 10 14    If database records show that a registered motor vehicle
 10 15 is not covered under an owner's policy of liability insurance
 10 16 for three months, the designated agent shall send a notice to
 10 17 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 10 18 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 10 19 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 10 20 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 10 21 notice will be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 10 22 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration will be
 10 23 revoked by the department and the owner will be required to
 10 24 surrender the registration plates and registration receipt for
 10 25 the vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a
 10 26 new registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 10 27 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 10 28 fee of $100. The fees are to be used by the department
 10 29 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program.
 10 30 Any fees in excess of the amount needed for administration of
 10 31 the program are to be transferred to the road use tax fund
 10 32 annually on June 30.
 10 33    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 10 34 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 10 35 policy, that fact shall be noted in the database, with a
 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
 11  2 owner.
 11  3    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 11  4 fraudulent information to the department or the department's
 11  5 designated agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance
 11  6 verification program.  A violation is a simple misdemeanor.
 11  7    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy that
 11  8 includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured motorist
 11  9 coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or personal injury
 11 10 coverage to the owner of a motor vehicle to provide, before
 11 11 the 7th and the 21st of each month, to the department's
 11 12 designated agent a record of each motor vehicle insurance
 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8  4 or motor vehicle for the time period designated by the
  8  5 government agency or court.
  8  6    c.  Upon request, the department or its designated agent
  8  7 shall disclose whether an individual is covered under a motor

  8  9    (1)  The individual or, if the individual is deceased,
  8 10 any person who is an interested party in the estate of the
  8 11 individual as provided under chapter 633.
  8 12    (2)  The parent or legal guardian of the individual if the
  8 13 individual is an unemancipated minor.
  8 14    (3)  The legal guardian of the individual if the individual
  8 15 is legally incapacitated.
  8 16    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  8 17    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the
  8 18 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
  8 21 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part

  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage

  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official

  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance

  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.

  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.
  9 29                           EXPLANATION
  9 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  9 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  9 32    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
  9 33 program within the department of transportation.  The
  9 34 department is required to contract with a third party to act
  9 35 as the department's designated agent for administration of the
 10  1 program.
 10  2    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain
 10  3 a database containing information from insurers relating to
 10  4 motor vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles,
 10  5 personal identification information for licensed drivers
 10  6 provided by the department, and any other information provided
 10  7 to the designated agent by the department.
 10  8    At least twice a month, the designated agent shall update the
 10  9 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 10 10 updated insurance information.  The files in the database shall
 10 11 be archived semiannually and audited by the department at least
 10 12 annually.  The bill requires the department to adopt rules for
 10 13 administration of the database.
 10 14    If database records show that a registered motor vehicle
 10 15 is not covered under an owner's policy of liability insurance
 10 16 for three months, the designated agent shall send a notice to
 10 17 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 10 18 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 10 19 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 10 20 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 10 21 notice will be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 10 22 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration will be
 10 23 revoked by the department and the owner will be required to
 10 24 surrender the registration plates and registration receipt for
 10 25 the vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a
 10 26 new registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 10 27 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 10 28 fee of $100. The fees are to be used by the department
 10 29 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program.
 10 30 Any fees in excess of the amount needed for administration of
 10 31 the program are to be transferred to the road use tax fund
 10 32 annually on June 30.
 10 33    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 10 34 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 10 35 policy, that fact shall be noted in the database, with a
 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
 11  2 owner.
 11  3    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 11  4 fraudulent information to the department or the department's
 11  5 designated agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance
 11  6 verification program.  A violation is a simple misdemeanor.
 11  7    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy that
 11  8 includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured motorist
 11  9 coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or personal injury
 11 10 coverage to the owner of a motor vehicle to provide, before
 11 11 the 7th and the 21st of each month, to the department's
 11 12 designated agent a record of each motor vehicle insurance
 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8  7 shall disclose whether an individual is covered under a motor
  8  8 vehicle insurance policy and the insurance company name to:
  8  9    (1)  The individual or, if the individual is deceased,
  8 10 any person who is an interested party in the estate of the
  8 11 individual as provided under chapter 633.
  8 12    (2)  The parent or legal guardian of the individual if the
  8 13 individual is an unemancipated minor.
  8 14    (3)  The legal guardian of the individual if the individual
  8 15 is legally incapacitated.
  8 16    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  8 17    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the
  8 18 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
  8 21 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
  8 22 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.

  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.
  9 29                           EXPLANATION
  9 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  9 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  9 32    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
  9 33 program within the department of transportation.  The
  9 34 department is required to contract with a third party to act
  9 35 as the department's designated agent for administration of the
 10  1 program.
 10  2    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain
 10  3 a database containing information from insurers relating to
 10  4 motor vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles,
 10  5 personal identification information for licensed drivers
 10  6 provided by the department, and any other information provided
 10  7 to the designated agent by the department.
 10  8    At least twice a month, the designated agent shall update the
 10  9 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 10 10 updated insurance information.  The files in the database shall
 10 11 be archived semiannually and audited by the department at least
 10 12 annually.  The bill requires the department to adopt rules for
 10 13 administration of the database.
 10 14    If database records show that a registered motor vehicle
 10 15 is not covered under an owner's policy of liability insurance
 10 16 for three months, the designated agent shall send a notice to
 10 17 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 10 18 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 10 19 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 10 20 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 10 21 notice will be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 10 22 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration will be
 10 23 revoked by the department and the owner will be required to
 10 24 surrender the registration plates and registration receipt for
 10 25 the vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a
 10 26 new registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 10 27 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 10 28 fee of $100. The fees are to be used by the department
 10 29 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program.
 10 30 Any fees in excess of the amount needed for administration of
 10 31 the program are to be transferred to the road use tax fund
 10 32 annually on June 30.
 10 33    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 10 34 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 10 35 policy, that fact shall be noted in the database, with a
 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
 11  2 owner.
 11  3    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 11  4 fraudulent information to the department or the department's
 11  5 designated agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance
 11  6 verification program.  A violation is a simple misdemeanor.
 11  7    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy that
 11  8 includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured motorist
 11  9 coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or personal injury
 11 10 coverage to the owner of a motor vehicle to provide, before
 11 11 the 7th and the 21st of each month, to the department's
 11 12 designated agent a record of each motor vehicle insurance
 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8 11 individual as provided under chapter 633.
  8 12    (2)  The parent or legal guardian of the individual if the
  8 13 individual is an unemancipated minor.
  8 14    (3)  The legal guardian of the individual if the individual
  8 15 is legally incapacitated.
  8 16    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  8 17    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the
  8 18 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
  8 21 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
  8 22 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.

 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8 14    (3)  The legal guardian of the individual if the individual
  8 15 is legally incapacitated.
  8 16    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  8 17    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the
  8 18 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
  8 21 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
  8 22 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.
  9 29                           EXPLANATION
  9 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  9 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  9 32    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
  9 33 program within the department of transportation.  The
  9 34 department is required to contract with a third party to act
  9 35 as the department's designated agent for administration of the
 10  1 program.
 10  2    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain
 10  3 a database containing information from insurers relating to
 10  4 motor vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles,
 10  5 personal identification information for licensed drivers
 10  6 provided by the department, and any other information provided
 10  7 to the designated agent by the department.
 10  8    At least twice a month, the designated agent shall update the
 10  9 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 10 10 updated insurance information.  The files in the database shall
 10 11 be archived semiannually and audited by the department at least
 10 12 annually.  The bill requires the department to adopt rules for
 10 13 administration of the database.
 10 14    If database records show that a registered motor vehicle
 10 15 is not covered under an owner's policy of liability insurance
 10 16 for three months, the designated agent shall send a notice to
 10 17 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 10 18 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 10 19 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 10 20 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 10 21 notice will be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 10 22 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration will be
 10 23 revoked by the department and the owner will be required to
 10 24 surrender the registration plates and registration receipt for
 10 25 the vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a
 10 26 new registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 10 27 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 10 28 fee of $100. The fees are to be used by the department
 10 29 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program.
 10 30 Any fees in excess of the amount needed for administration of
 10 31 the program are to be transferred to the road use tax fund
 10 32 annually on June 30.
 10 33    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 10 34 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 10 35 policy, that fact shall be noted in the database, with a
 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
 11  2 owner.
 11  3    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 11  4 fraudulent information to the department or the department's
 11  5 designated agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance
 11  6 verification program.  A violation is a simple misdemeanor.
 11  7    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy that
 11  8 includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured motorist
 11  9 coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or personal injury
 11 10 coverage to the owner of a motor vehicle to provide, before
 11 11 the 7th and the 21st of each month, to the department's
 11 12 designated agent a record of each motor vehicle insurance
 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh

  8 16    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  8 17    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the

  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle

 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8 18 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
  8 21 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
  8 22 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.
  9 29                           EXPLANATION
  9 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  9 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  9 32    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
  9 33 program within the department of transportation.  The
  9 34 department is required to contract with a third party to act
  9 35 as the department's designated agent for administration of the
 10  1 program.
 10  2    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain
 10  3 a database containing information from insurers relating to
 10  4 motor vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles,
 10  5 personal identification information for licensed drivers
 10  6 provided by the department, and any other information provided
 10  7 to the designated agent by the department.
 10  8    At least twice a month, the designated agent shall update the
 10  9 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 10 10 updated insurance information.  The files in the database shall
 10 11 be archived semiannually and audited by the department at least
 10 12 annually.  The bill requires the department to adopt rules for
 10 13 administration of the database.
 10 14    If database records show that a registered motor vehicle
 10 15 is not covered under an owner's policy of liability insurance
 10 16 for three months, the designated agent shall send a notice to
 10 17 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 10 18 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 10 19 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 10 20 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 10 21 notice will be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 10 22 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration will be
 10 23 revoked by the department and the owner will be required to
 10 24 surrender the registration plates and registration receipt for
 10 25 the vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a
 10 26 new registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 10 27 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 10 28 fee of $100. The fees are to be used by the department
 10 29 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program.
 10 30 Any fees in excess of the amount needed for administration of
 10 31 the program are to be transferred to the road use tax fund
 10 32 annually on June 30.
 10 33    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 10 34 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 10 35 policy, that fact shall be noted in the database, with a
 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
 11  2 owner.
 11  3    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 11  4 fraudulent information to the department or the department's
 11  5 designated agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance
 11  6 verification program.  A violation is a simple misdemeanor.
 11  7    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy that
 11  8 includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured motorist
 11  9 coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or personal injury
 11 10 coverage to the owner of a motor vehicle to provide, before
 11 11 the 7th and the 21st of each month, to the department's
 11 12 designated agent a record of each motor vehicle insurance
 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8 19 request is made.
  8 20    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
  8 21 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
  8 22 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage

  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance

  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.
  9 29                           EXPLANATION
  9 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  9 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  9 32    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
  9 33 program within the department of transportation.  The
  9 34 department is required to contract with a third party to act
  9 35 as the department's designated agent for administration of the
 10  1 program.
 10  2    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain
 10  3 a database containing information from insurers relating to
 10  4 motor vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles,
 10  5 personal identification information for licensed drivers
 10  6 provided by the department, and any other information provided
 10  7 to the designated agent by the department.
 10  8    At least twice a month, the designated agent shall update the
 10  9 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 10 10 updated insurance information.  The files in the database shall
 10 11 be archived semiannually and audited by the department at least
 10 12 annually.  The bill requires the department to adopt rules for
 10 13 administration of the database.
 10 14    If database records show that a registered motor vehicle
 10 15 is not covered under an owner's policy of liability insurance
 10 16 for three months, the designated agent shall send a notice to
 10 17 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 10 18 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 10 19 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 10 20 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 10 21 notice will be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 10 22 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration will be
 10 23 revoked by the department and the owner will be required to
 10 24 surrender the registration plates and registration receipt for
 10 25 the vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a
 10 26 new registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 10 27 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 10 28 fee of $100. The fees are to be used by the department
 10 29 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program.
 10 30 Any fees in excess of the amount needed for administration of
 10 31 the program are to be transferred to the road use tax fund
 10 32 annually on June 30.
 10 33    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 10 34 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 10 35 policy, that fact shall be noted in the database, with a
 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
 11  2 owner.
 11  3    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 11  4 fraudulent information to the department or the department's
 11  5 designated agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance
 11  6 verification program.  A violation is a simple misdemeanor.
 11  7    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy that
 11  8 includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured motorist
 11  9 coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or personal injury
 11 10 coverage to the owner of a motor vehicle to provide, before
 11 11 the 7th and the 21st of each month, to the department's
 11 12 designated agent a record of each motor vehicle insurance
 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8 23 to access to accident reports.
  8 24    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
  8 25 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
  8 26 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official

  8 32 information contained in the database.

  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance

  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:

  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.

  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.
  9 29                           EXPLANATION
  9 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  9 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  9 32    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
  9 33 program within the department of transportation.  The
  9 34 department is required to contract with a third party to act
  9 35 as the department's designated agent for administration of the
 10  1 program.
 10  2    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain
 10  3 a database containing information from insurers relating to
 10  4 motor vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles,
 10  5 personal identification information for licensed drivers
 10  6 provided by the department, and any other information provided
 10  7 to the designated agent by the department.
 10  8    At least twice a month, the designated agent shall update the
 10  9 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 10 10 updated insurance information.  The files in the database shall
 10 11 be archived semiannually and audited by the department at least
 10 12 annually.  The bill requires the department to adopt rules for
 10 13 administration of the database.
 10 14    If database records show that a registered motor vehicle
 10 15 is not covered under an owner's policy of liability insurance
 10 16 for three months, the designated agent shall send a notice to
 10 17 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 10 18 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 10 19 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 10 20 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 10 21 notice will be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 10 22 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration will be
 10 23 revoked by the department and the owner will be required to
 10 24 surrender the registration plates and registration receipt for
 10 25 the vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a
 10 26 new registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 10 27 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 10 28 fee of $100. The fees are to be used by the department
 10 29 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program.
 10 30 Any fees in excess of the amount needed for administration of
 10 31 the program are to be transferred to the road use tax fund
 10 32 annually on June 30.
 10 33    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 10 34 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 10 35 policy, that fact shall be noted in the database, with a
 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
 11  2 owner.
 11  3    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 11  4 fraudulent information to the department or the department's
 11  5 designated agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance
 11  6 verification program.  A violation is a simple misdemeanor.
 11  7    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy that
 11  8 includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured motorist
 11  9 coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or personal injury
 11 10 coverage to the owner of a motor vehicle to provide, before
 11 11 the 7th and the 21st of each month, to the department's
 11 12 designated agent a record of each motor vehicle insurance
 11 13 policy issued by the insurer and in effect for vehicles
 11 14 registered or garaged in this state as of the date of the
 11 15 previous submission.  Insurers that issue commercial motor
 11 16 vehicle insurance policies must also provide a record of each
 11 17 commercial motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the insurer
 11 18 and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in this state
 11 19 as of the date of the previous submission.  Vehicles subject to
 11 20 apportioned registration are not included in this requirement.
 11 21 Insurers that fail to comply with the reporting requirement
 11 22 may be assessed a civil penalty of $250 per day.  However,
 11 23 the department may waive the penalty upon a showing that the
 11 24 failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
 11 25 neglect.
 11 26    Information contained in the database is confidential,
 11 27 but the bill provides exceptions for disclosures to state or
 11 28 local government agencies and courts for specified purposes;
 11 29 to individuals and certain other authorized persons; for
 11 30 purposes of an accident investigation; to law enforcement
 11 31 agencies and peace officers for certain official purposes;
 11 32 to the state auditor; and to financial institutions with a
 11 33 security interest in a motor vehicle.  The designated agent
 11 34 may be authorized to provide certified copies or electronic
 11 35 records, as appropriate, and to charge a fee for the provision
 12  1 of records and authentication of documents.
 12  2    A person who knowingly releases or discloses information
 12  3 from the database for a purpose other than those authorized in
 12  4 the bill or to a person who is not entitled to such information
 12  5 is guilty of a class "D" felony.
 12  6    The bill provides that the state and the department's
 12  7 designated agent are not liable to any person for gathering,
 12  8 managing, or using the information in the database in
 12  9 compliance with the bill.
 12 10    The bill provides for an effective date of July 1, 2016.
       LSB 1042HH (3) 86
       ns/nh
  8 27 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
  8 28 enforcement agencies.
  8 29    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
  8 30 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
  8 31 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
  8 32 information contained in the database.
  8 33    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
  8 34 of the program.
  8 35    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
  9  1 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
  9  2 interest in a motor vehicle.
  9  3    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
  9  4 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
  9  5 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
  9  6 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
  9  7    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
  9  8 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
  9  9    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
  9 10 another electronic medium if the department determines that
  9 11 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
  9 12 section.
  9 13    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
  9 14 fee established by the department for each of the following:
  9 15    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
  9 16 delivery of a certified copy.
  9 17    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
  9 18 another electronic medium.
  9 19    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
  9 20 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
  9 21    3.  Any person who knowingly releases or discloses
  9 22 information from the database for a purpose other than those
  9 23 authorized in this section or to a person who is not entitled
  9 24 to such information is guilty of a class "D" felony.
  9 25    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
  9 26 is liable to any person for gathering, managing, or using the
  9 27 information in the database in compliance with this chapter.
  9 28    Sec. 8.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1, 2016.

 11  1 requirement that the information be updated annually by the
